website_summaries.verdict: Portable AM radio works anywhere thanks to rechargeable AA batteries.
pros: Uses digital tuner to dial in an exact signal
Stores up to 5 preset AM stations
Easy-to-read LCD screen lets you see the exact station to which you're tuned
cons: Signal quality over a distance is lacking

customer_reviews.title: Bad Design and Died Way Too Soon
customer_reviews.text: The tapered volume control on the side is smooth and hard to get a hold of. The radio is more likely to squirt away from you than to adjust its volume -- a very stupid bit of design. Moreover, the radio completely died after only 5 months. This was out of the Amazon return period and the manufacturer's guarantee requires an $8 handling fee. Frankly, I'm not willing to pump 8 more dollars into the dumb thing. It had pretty good sound back when it worked -- but really...
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Sangean Is The Name
customer_reviews.text: A Sangean product that has not disappointed at all. It is pleasant in its appearance. It is easy to use. It has 5 favorite buttons for FM favorites and 5 for AM favs. The reception is much better than any other portable radio that I have used. The screen lights up when turning off, but only for some amount of seconds. The batteries have yet to be recharged or replaced, but then I do not use it every day and never for any longer than 30 minutes. It seems very well made and looks like it, too. I would definitely recommend it. Sangean's name in this product is as good as Samsung, maybe even better.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: The power pack/transformer died after a month. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.text: The power pack stopped working after a month, and I just missed my return window. Also, there are no Radio Shacks around any more, so finding a replacement power pack is out of the question. So I have a radio that takes 6 AA batteries that last a week at the most. And I haven't even mentioned the poor reception and the fact that it tips over if you look at it crosseyed. A piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Squazeedle

customer_reviews.title: Stops working on adaptor--batteries only.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th radio like this. Each one has worked beautifully on the adaptor for several months and then worked only on batteries (which don't last long at all). The adaptor has been tested by an electrician and is fine. Others have had the same issue (see one star reviews). I called the company and the rep. seemed really bored with my complaint, telling me he had never heard of such a problem and told me to return the radio with $8.00 and pay for shipping. Why? I would only be adding a fifth! Sangean used to be a fine product.
customer_reviews.author: Judith E. Bunch

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a couple months
customer_reviews.text: I love the radio but it is unreliable. Bought this in December 2017, 2-3 months later it stopped working. Sent it in on warranty to manufacturer (but you still have to pay $15 for shipping). Received radio back repaired. 2-3 months later, radio stopped working again. Sent in for repair 2nd time to manufacturer. Received back a new radio. It’s now September 2018, and new radio has stopped working! Not sure what to do from here. Regretting buying this radio.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua K.

customer_reviews.title: I had a similar sangean had it for 10years no ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a similar sangean had it for 10years no problem it finally broke. Replaced it with a new one last ONE DAY spend your money wisely I'm not buying another sangean.
customer_reviews.author: bob santanello

customer_reviews.title: Great radio, poor charger
customer_reviews.text: I like this radio. In fact, I've purchased 3. Sounds good, good reception, looks good. The charging circuit: not so much. After the first discharge cycle - or so - charging becomes very poor. Run time is a few minutes and recharge claims to be complete in a few minutes. I've seen this with all 3 radios and several different NiMH battery vendors, including Amazon basics. [edit to add] In one case the radio wouldn't charge the batteries at all. Batteries would still recharge in an external charger. I'd give it 5 stars, but the recharge ability is essentially useless.
customer_reviews.author: Zoltan the Gypsy

customer_reviews.title: Before you buy anything,,,,,
customer_reviews.text: I am a radio geek. Days past, home component analog tube and solid state. Now, maybe 25-30 radios under $100. Nothing but nothing I own or tried will touch this radio (including the mighty Super III) in pulling and holding a station. Both AM and FM. An analog rotory volume knob scores big with me, too. Recharges AA, an affordable way to go. I can't find fault aside what has already been said about gloss finish and no handle. Buy a pouch with shoulder strap, if need be.
customer_reviews.author: TheTunerGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and reception, but charging system is a weakness.
customer_reviews.text: This radio has superb ability to pull in FM signals from far away in rural areas; far better than others I own or have owned. The sound quality is well above average as well. However, it fails to recharge the batteries I bought from Amazon. If I remove the batteries, they charge fine in an external charger. I contacted the distributor in California and they are willing to repair the radio under warranty, but I have to pay postage both ways. This represents more than a quarter the price of the radio. Having read some reviews, it would appear that my problem is not unique. I guess I will use my external charger instead.
customer_reviews.author: Kayemtee

customer_reviews.title: Nice but with one giant flaw.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the looks of this radio and it was easy to set up. BUT! For the life of me I cannot figure out how to turn the alarm off so it does not go on everyday. I read the manual, it says to push the standby button (but no where does it tell me what or where that is) chatted with help, pushed every conceivable button or buttons but nothing or no one seems to be able to figure how to turn the alarm to the off position so it won’t go on like weekends and holidays. I also bought another model of this radio and it had the same problem I am returning both.
customer_reviews.author: Noodlehead

customer_reviews.title: Great to have rechargeable option
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice radio. Love the presets, the ability to use rechargeable batteries and then just plug it in for a recharge. I have had this for 3 months and have recharged it twice. With so many disasters this year: floods, hurricanes, fires and their power outages, it is really a safety factor to have a portable radio for up to date news and instructions in case of emergency. It is also very nice looking.
customer_reviews.author: Emmy Bea

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: The radio worked fine with alkaline batteries, however, it did not work at all with the AC adapter that was sent with it. I could not find any information on the Sangean website and saw there were several posts by individuals having the same difficulty. I returned the radio for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Bassoon Lady

customer_reviews.title: Great radio with one BIG flaw!
customer_reviews.text: I have another Sangean radio which love, so I was excited to get this one to take camping, but I soon discovered that I couldn't pack it in anything without it turning on 'by itself' due to the fact that the on button is to vulnerable ant pressure. It should have been recessed below the surface or sliding switch or other. I decoded to try packing it in its original styrofoam and box, but it still turns on with lightest pressure. In fact it kept turning on even on the drive home. It is a great radio, so I will probably try to make something I can store it in that will prevent this.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Great radio. Junk charging circuit.
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is very decent with FULLY charged nimh batteries. That said the onboard charger that will charge said nimh batteries is trash. It doesn’t fully charge the cells and subsequently kills them after a few dozen charges. I’ve used amazon and eneloops with the same results which is disappointing knowing how long those high quality cells should last. Great radio otherwise. It just has a crummy charging circuit.
customer_reviews.author: J. Meissner

customer_reviews.title: Nice little radio
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Good reception, clear sound, can use regular or rechargeable batteries. Cons: May have a defect. Mine locked up one time and had to have the batteries removed to make it come back. Also, now has a vibration even with it not turned on. We've had the larger one (PR-5) for years and it gets even better reception and has no problems except it eats a lot of 'C' Cell batteries.
customer_reviews.author: CPlogic

customer_reviews.title: it may sound dumb to keep buying something that does not hold up ...
customer_reviews.text: this is my 4th one. it may sound dumb to keep buying something that does not hold up but it is the only one that gets so many out of state programs and clearly. it self recharges and it so easy to operate in the dark at night. I also have the little digital earphone radio. I just love that also
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but power button stopped working properly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radio just over two years ago. The sound is five stars. I love it. I have to knock-off two stars, because the power button has apparently worn out and does not operate right. Sometimes I have to press it two to four times to turn the radio on or off. Also, when turning off the radio, pressing the power button changes the tuning, as if I were pressing the "up" tuning button. The unit is out of warranty (90-days), so I am stuck with it. This problem is a disappointing surprise, because I bought the Sangean H-201 shower radio in 2010 and it still works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: soigne

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for minimal use. Wobbly stand.
customer_reviews.text: I use it minimally in a bathroom 5-10 minutes at a Time so it is OK, just average on the sound. MY CC Radio sounds much better I payed 160 for it though .My Laptop sounds better. Most devices sound great with headphones,The D7 sounds average. The feet on the radio make it wobble every time I touch it . Buttons are all 5 stars so far. Love the tapered volume switch .It seems like it will keep water off the volume switch during my kids steam baths.
customer_reviews.author: deo

customer_reviews.title: Won’t recharge some kind of batteries (UPDATED)
customer_reviews.text: Good sound, average FM radio reception and it won’t charge the batteries that I got for it. I’ll leave a picture so you know what battery not to buy. I just realized that there's a switch when you open the battery compartment that you suppose to turn it to "recharge" instead of "alkaline"
customer_reviews.author: Andres

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on October 22nd 2018. Great reception, great sound, however where the AC/DC power supply plugs into the radio has failed. No longer can use radio. Used for less than 2 month's. I contacted sangean, I have to pay shipping both ways roughly $16! This is crap. How is this my fault? This is a common issue with these that I didn't notice in the reviews. They should send me a new one which I'm not sure I want anyway because of the flaw or refund me.
customer_reviews.author: M. Turner

customer_reviews.title: great for two weeks
customer_reviews.text: great for two weeks . Then quick working in battery mode. Tried new rechargeable and alkaline. No go. Very disappointing. The warranty requires a eight dollar charge plus you have to pay ups charges.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald H.

customer_reviews.title: Remarkable Sound - Easy to Operate!
customer_reviews.text: Second time purchasing this radio for my wife who is using it in her office - first radio is still in use. Compact, easy to operate, excellent reception and great sound quality. Accommodates rechargeable batteries for use in the event of power failure - which are kept charged through the AC power connection. Rechargeable batteries not included. For the price, there is none better. Strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Sr

customer_reviews.title: Used, NOT refurbished
customer_reviews.text: This is a USED product, nothing refurbished about it. Expect signs of wear and even scratches in the finish.It will arrive without a user manual (can download from internet) and without any batteries. After using it 10 minutes I turned it off. It would not turn on after that. Returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: P. Versage

customer_reviews.title: Died After Just One Year ---argggh
customer_reviews.text: What a waste of money!!! As long as I keep fresh batteries in this thing, it is ok for a clock. However, the radio and alarms do not work, it no longer charges batteries, and the adapter no longer seems to work at all. There are much better looking clocks out there. This is a waste of money if you want a radio or an alarm clock!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ella

customer_reviews.title: CHARGES YOUR RECHARGEABLE BATTERIES AS IT IS PLUGGED IN WITHOUT TAKING THE BATTERIES OUT
customer_reviews.text: JUST GOT THIS TODAY BUT SO FAR WE LOVE IT. IT IS LIGHT AND SMALL AND CLEAR VOICES ON EACH STATION. SO EASY TO TOTE TO ANY ROOM YOU WANT. THE PLUS SIDE YOU CAN USE RECHARGEABLE BATTERIES AND THE RADIO CHARGES THEM WITHOUT HAVING TO TAKE THEM OUT AND CHARGED ON A SEPARATE CHARGER. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS RADIO AND I HAVE ABOUT FOUR RADIOS COLLECTING BECAUSE THEY HAVEN’T WORKED OUT FOR US. GETTING A PORTABLE RADIO THESE DAYS THAT WILL CHARGE YOUR BATTERIES IS VERY HARD TO FIND. THIS FITS THE BILL FOR US.
customer_reviews.author: Greeha

customer_reviews.title: POOR VALUE
customer_reviews.text: THE RADIO IS ADVERTISED AS BEING A DIGITAL RECHARGEABLE PORTABLE RADIO. WHAT IS NOT CLEAR IS THAT YOU NEED TO SPEND AN ADDITIONAL $20 TO PURCHASE RECHARGEABLE BATTERIES. THE RADIO SHOULD INCLUDE THE RECHARGEABLE BATTERIES. ALSO THE ALKALINE BATTERIES WHICH WERE ALSO NOT INCLUDED DO NOT LAST THE 38 HOURS STATED. I AM ON MY THIRD SET OF 6 BATTERIES IN A LITTLE OVER 5 WEEKS WITH A DAILY USAGE OF 2 HOURS PER DAY. I WAS GOING TO RETURN THE RADIO BUT WAS ONE DAY OVER THE 30 RETURN POLICY. NEEDLESS TO SAY I AM NOT VERY HAPPY WITH MY PURCHASE. DON'T ADVERTISE A $55 RADIO THAT NEEDS AN ADDITIONAL $20 EXPENDITURE TO UTILIZE THE FEATURES.
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM A. SLOANE,JR

customer_reviews.title: Used for entertainment source and emergency radio
customer_reviews.text: We needed to replace a 24 year old analog tuned radio and decided to go digital to avoid tuning drift. Knowing what goes into a digitally tuned radio I was a bit surprised at the price, but when you consider that it also includes a battery charger (it uses six AA batteries) and a backlit display, the price is almost justified. We live in the Midwest and enjoy occasional wild weather accompanied now and again by tornadoes. Having a battery powered radio is on our list of essentials and this product fits that need admirably.
customer_reviews.author: John Waidner

customer_reviews.title: Will not work without batteries
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty disappointed that the radio only works if you have batteries installed. The (AC) Power supply included is only for charging the batteries. (Which do not come with the radio) The power supply DOES NOT power the radio. Also the connection jack on the side of the radio says DC which you can not see in the few pictures provided. It seems like a nice radio other than that. Still I feel like I was ripped off and that information should clearly be stated in the details.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Nice little radio
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small radio for our bathroom, and this fits the bill. It takes up very little room and the reception is excellent. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the display is not very bright. It lights up when it's first turned on, but then it goes out, so it's a little difficult to see the time, but that's a minor problem.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lange

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Radio but needs a Handle
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed with the build quality of this radio. Easy to use controls, good sound quality and handy rechargeable batteries feature. But it really needs a handle to make it easier to handle it and to move it around. Also, the narrow design makes it prone to tipping over or blowing over if you use it outside, which is why I bought it. I got tired of dragging around a long heavy extension cord to use with another radio when doing gardening/landscape work in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Larry from Tampa

customer_reviews.title: Love this radio
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent radio with wonderful FM reception. Considerably better reception than either my Sony or Pioneer radios. I love everything about this radio except would have liked a carry handle and a knurled knob for the volume control. The radio is easy to carry with one hand but a little bit slippery, The knob is smooth and with gloves on difficult to adjust volume. These do not over ride the satisfaction of this radios reception or overall quality and sound. I have recommend it to my brother who lives, as I do, in a mountainous local with difficult reception issues. I highly recommend this radio..
customer_reviews.author: David Wright

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I work in a prison - walls are thick and windows are sparse. I needed a radio that could catch a signal easily and let me tell you this one does it! Other people I work with have radios that have string/wire antenna, which usually seem to be the only kind that can catch a signal. I was scared when this didn't have that, but rather a pull up type.... it doesn't even matter! I have the antenna pushed all the way down and locked in place. The radio works great!!
customer_reviews.author: Christal

customer_reviews.title: Decent Radio
customer_reviews.text: The sound and reception quality of this radio is very good for its suburb location. A couple of dings that I have is that there isn't enough slots for preset radio stations. 5 for AM and 5 for FM. I knew that when buying the radio. My biggest gripe is no radio case. Considering this is more or less a portable radio, no case comes with the unit. This obviously sucks for transporting on camping trips. A carrying handle would have been nice so you don't have to grab the body of the radio and inadvertently turn it on!
customer_reviews.author: everydayJoe

customer_reviews.title: Sangean radio, very good for 15 months then stopped working!!! Model PR-D7
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this radio on March 30, 2018. On June 30, 2019 it stopped working. I could only run this radio off direct current from day 1. I could never run this radio off batteries, it would not work. I liked the sound. No one buys a new radio that lasts only 15 months and does not run off batteries as it claims to! NOT HAPPY with this radio. I would NOT purchase this radio if you expect it to last more that 15 months!!!
customer_reviews.author: Viking Joe

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME RADIO
customer_reviews.text: Live just north of Milwaukee County and I have always had a problem getting AM stations that came if clear on a portable radio - Now all FM and AM stations come in very, very clear - what I also like is that you just push and hold the 'off' button and you will see 60 min, then 45 min, then 30 min and finally 15 min - when you see how long you want the radio to stay on just take your finger off and that's it - Really like that feature - If for example you wanted 30 min and were to slow to take your finger off, just start over and hold off button again
customer_reviews.author: BOB - MEQUON,WI

customer_reviews.title: Mine stopped working after about a year and a half
customer_reviews.text: I bought this due to the good reviews here, but mine started having problems powering up after about a year and finally died about six months later. AC or DC nothing worked. It's getting harder and harder to find good radios anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: This Is The Greatest
customer_reviews.text: I use AM radio at night and it is so hard to find good sound when you are listening to talk radio. This sharp little radio is so perfect. I have had many and they haven't been able to deliver the sound I want. This radio is the best I have had and it takes rechargeable batteries which makes it even better. I don't like to have it plugged in so running on batteries is great for me. There is a battery life indicator so when it needs charging I will just plug it in. It was easy to set up with the great instructions and the sound is static free and easy to understand.
customer_reviews.author: Mamacoffee

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, especially by HWS
customer_reviews.text: The "Humane Wake System" (HWS) is a very bad feature. It sounds terrible, which would be fine if I could disable it, but I cannot. I would like to be able to set my own radio alarm volume (quieter). This D7 also gets poorer reception than my old D5 did before I broke it. Also, and not terribly important, the interface has a bug: long pressing the alarm button is supposed to activate the alarm; instead, the radio cycles through the alarm-set interface every time. A nuisance.
customer_reviews.author: sleepykitty

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money -- ports suck, battery life sucks
customer_reviews.text: AC adapter port dies in a few weeks -- therefore batteries cannot be recharged while in the radio. Then the ear port dies.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hakohen

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to do very well
customer_reviews.text: Freaking love this thing! Better sensitivity than my $700 Onkyo A/V rcvr, on AM and FM. Love the re-chargeable battery option. Only draw-back is durability. Buddy dropped one (from about 2 ft), and battery compartment door came completely apart. Otherwise it still worked perfectly. It's an AM/FM radio w/ an alarm. Nothing fancy, but it does what it is supposed to do very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Gloria

customer_reviews.title: Good office radio for poor reception area
customer_reviews.text: I work at home in an area with somewhat limited radio and cell reception as we are in a bit of a low hollow in the neighborhood. I've had issues with poor and broken reception periodically but, since getting this radio, have had little to no issues. So far, after 2 or 3 months, the occasional issues I've had were station specific, not general reception specific. In addition, there is one relatively local station I sometimes like to listen to that has limited power that I am able to get with nearly perfect reception where it was extremely sporadic before.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy K. Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Great Radio
customer_reviews.text: I really like this radio. I also have the Sangean PR-D18BK which is smaller but doesn't include the power adapter. I bought this PR-D7 BK radio because I wanted to be able to plug it in as I have it on most of the day and just using batteries I would always be changing them. The presets work the same as the PR-D18 which I really like as well. The volume button on the PR-D7 is on the side and is a knob that easily turns and is more convenient that the + or - that you use on the PR-D18. This radio is bigger than the PR-D18 but is still small enough to not take up much space.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie Brune

customer_reviews.title: Supposed to work with rechargeable batteries - NOPE.
customer_reviews.text: I tried three different sets of rechargeable batteries and it would not charge them. I wanted this little radio for camping because somebody told me that they have one that works awesome. I called Amazon tech-support, because it is offered, and they were not helpful at all. I was skeptical about tech-support because what are the chances that they know everything about all the electronics they sell. Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: 4evr MOM

customer_reviews.title: ... because the sound from our clock radios is very poor. The radio in our clock radios gets poor ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this radio for our bedroom because the sound from our clock radios is very poor. The radio in our clock radios gets poor reception even from close stations, This Sangen is a very good radio with good reception and very good sound. The clock is hard to see without turning on the backlight so we kept the LED clock radio as our clock, and the Sangen as the radio.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Poor Audio, Poor Reception
customer_reviews.text: I have had three Sangean portables. They all had great reception and great sound. This one does not. I can barely pull in local AM and FM stations that my pocket sized Sangean handles with no problem. The speakers are clipped and tinny. Almost inaudible. Delivery was great. Product is terrible. Find something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact yet great for hearing distant stations and also for power outages and camping.
customer_reviews.text: Nice compact but not tiny size. Automatically recharges 6 AA NiMH cells inside as needed when connected to the included wall power supply or an optional cord from 12 vdc [not included] Charger shuts off when you turn on the radio and does not interfere with hearing stations while plugged in. So great for use in a camper or during a power outage. Pretty sensitive on AM and really shines with an external loop antenna. Not as sensitive as the PR-D 15 or PR-D4W without an external loop, but surpasses them when all use an external loop antenna. Voice audio on AM is especially clear and easy to understand.
customer_reviews.author: FARMERIK

customer_reviews.title: This Is A Great Portable Radio
customer_reviews.text: I have had many radios over my life and this is absolutely the best one. The sound quality is great and it picks up more stations than all other small radios I have owned. It can be plugged into an outlet or operate anywhere using its batteries. It is a great value for the money and I can't think of any more one could wish for from a small portable radio.
customer_reviews.author: Baron Chicester

customer_reviews.title: Great portable radio.
customer_reviews.text: The Sangean has performed pretty much as advertised. It maintains it's charge for a decent amount of time although I typically only listen 15-20 minutes a day. But it went about a month and 1/2 before I had to plug it in again. I mostly listen to clear channel station WHO in DesMoines which is about 90 miles away. The signal degrades some in the early morning and later evening but moving the radio slightly usually fixes that problem, The sound is very clear. I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: williamissympatheticculture

customer_reviews.title: Great radio
customer_reviews.text: This a a great portable radio. I live literally 50 miles from nowhere and this little unit as able to pickup all kinds of stations. With the added feature of rechargeable batteries, it nice to have during power outages from hurricanes and such. Lightweight, attractive, easy to use............hard to beat. I think it has better reception than the desktop Sangean WR-2
customer_reviews.author: danno101

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I live in a very rural area, and purchased this for local AM stations. Based of the product description, it looked like it would pull in these stations. Because I have a flat screen TV, LED light fixtures, and light dimmers in my home, they all cause interference with the AM signal on this radio. All I get is buzzing on the AM band. This will not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Greyhound

customer_reviews.title: Running strong for over a DECADE
customer_reviews.text: I've had two of these radios for over 11 years now, and both are still running STRONG. I listen to NPR daily, so they have certainly gotten a LOT of use. I really like the dependability of the preset buttons, and the tuning and reception are excellent. I am so impressed by these radios. Really great quality, especially for this affordable price. They are built to last, so you are sure to get many years' of enjoyment from this superior product.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Recharger breaks in less than six months
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money. The connector inside the radio broke very quickly and radio was not able to be recharged. I was then forced to use regular alkali batteries. Avoid buying more expensive junk from China.
customer_reviews.author: Bill H

customer_reviews.title: Big sound in a small package
customer_reviews.text: I got this to be an "office radio" and didn't want to use my PRD-5 because space is at a premium. So I got this little guy and just set it up, and it's really nice. Big sound, small package. A few less bells and whistles than the PRD-5, presets are set up the same way, very intuitive. Great for typical office listening like NPR and talk radio in general.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best portable radio I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Everything you'd expect in a radio this size and in this price range. I do wish it had a handle or carrying strap. This is our second one ...my wife dropped the first one and the case broke but the radio still works fine. It did become hard to make the contact to recharge it so after the 'drop' so we had to use disposable batteries. That's why we replaced it with this one. It's a great radio!
customer_reviews.author: zzme

customer_reviews.title: The power cord does not work. Power cord or ...
customer_reviews.text: The power cord does not work. Power cord or the power connection plug in on the radio does not work. I will be sending returning this item. vince
customer_reviews.author: vince

customer_reviews.title: Good radio but remember to buy rechargeable batteries because it doesn't come with any
customer_reviews.text: Radio seems sturdy and not too heavy. But - it does not come with any rechargeable batteries as I thought it did. It does provide the feature of charging your rechargeable batteries which you need to buy separately. Reception is good. It would be even be better if there was a carrying handle given its size.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi7

customer_reviews.title: Solved my reception issues
customer_reviews.text: I had a Panasonic clock radio by my sink in our master bath. The reception was awful. The Sangean has excellent reception and occupies a lot less counter space. Sound quality is good. I switch back and forth between our local PBS station and a sports radio section, and the presets are very useful. This model is rechargeable versus other Sangean models, which is a plus. Note that the feature utilizes retail rechargeable batteries, e.g., Duracell, which must be bought separately. It can also use non-rechargeable batteries, however. A switch allows the user to choose which type of batteries he or she wants to use.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Awful sound
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radio because I needed something that got good reception in my office building. Based on other reviews, I thought this was the perfect fit. Wrong. The reception is awful. All I can hear is static. So I decided to use it at home. Reception is better, but the sound is awful. The speaker sounds like you are listening through a tin can. I was very disappointed in this radio.
customer_reviews.author: David A Fulton

customer_reviews.title: Had it a while, extremely pleased
customer_reviews.text: For the price point, this radio has remarkable sound and features that are useful. There may be a slight learning curve on using the features (there were for me), but certainly not a deal breaks. Sleep mode is a great feature, use it all the time. Also appears very durable. It's been tipped over on the night stand 3 or 4 times with no adverse effects.
customer_reviews.author: Jim2day

customer_reviews.title: sweet
customer_reviews.text: Love this radio. It looks real nice, picks up signals well, Keeps locked into a station at night, allows you to recharge your AA rechargeable batteries, and the digital auto tuning is a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: Jim E.

customer_reviews.title: Problem with power source!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, like everything about it except after a year the rechargeable batteries stopped charging and it won't run without fully charged batteries even plugged in! I spent a bundle on new rechargebles and that didn't help. NOT GOOD! Will be calling Sangean but can't tell from this Amazon site what the warranty is......
customer_reviews.author: Laura Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio
customer_reviews.text: This little radio is perfect for me to listen to NPR while I’m getting ready in the bathroom. I also use it while I’m cleaning. I love using my iPhone for listening to Apple Music, but can’t get my local NPR station on the phone without problems. Also love the color since it goes well with my bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: cavalierlvr

customer_reviews.title: Weak signal no batteries include
customer_reviews.text: The radio signal is not that great and no rechargeable battery which you spend more money to buy them. With the cost of $50 plus, I could get something better.
customer_reviews.author: Cyprus Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: small radio, excellent tuner, good value
customer_reviews.text: liked the first one so much, i purchased a second unit the same day i received the first. nice, small size, but speaker quality for talk is fine. tuner works very well, i am listening to stations that i knew existed but could never quite pull in. the digital presets work well, and the volume control dial is precise and gradual. the first unit i bought was new, and i paid full amazon price. the second unit was a return to amazon. almost 50% off. cosmetic issues accounted for the price drop. amazon rated it "acceptable", however i was hard pressed to identify the cosmetic flaw. a very nice deal for me.
customer_reviews.author: bacho

customer_reviews.title: If it played cds it would be perfect!
customer_reviews.text: compact, good reception (better than a much more expensive model), most of all, like the feature that allows you to lull youself to sleep by the radio for as little as 15 and as much as 120 minutes. Thinking of buying another one for summers spent outside...
customer_reviews.author: P. Grande

customer_reviews.title: Worth every dollar
customer_reviews.text: Seemed it bit pricey for such a little radio, but boy did it come thru in the Sangre de Cristo mtns of CO at 8,750'. I didn't get diddly radio stations with my el cheapo radios I bought at the Dollar stores in the little town I was near by. Now I get dozens of channels to pick from with this one. My car radio would do fairly well, but this little radio out performs it too. So nice to have something that works as described.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lile

customer_reviews.title: For some years it was a useful little radio
customer_reviews.text: For some years it was a useful little radio. Then the AC adapter started providing intermittent power - seemed the issue was where the plug fits into the radio, as I could sometimes wiggle it around and get power back. For a while I held it in a position where it functioned, with a rubber band. But eventually it failed to work at all with the AC adapter. Batteries still worked OK.
customer_reviews.author: Bear Magnet

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Bathroom Unit
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as bathroom counter-top radio for listening primarily to news/public affairs on NPR staions - rather than music. Serves this purpose perfectly: 1. Small footprint 2. Despite living in a hilly neighborhood where signals are blocked and reception often dicey - all 5 FM stations to which I consistently listen - are strong and crystal clear. Don't even need to extend the (ugly) telescoping antenna. Perfect Of course YMMV ps: Giving 4 stars only because battery compartment door on my unit fails to open as it should when pressed and pushed. Fortunately that's not a concern for me as I'm keeping unit plugged in and not installing any batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Great radio, but.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the radio. Great sound, easy to use, reception good. My only complaint is with the charging. It begin to charge, then the flashing display stops. Unfortunately, it is nowhere near charged. I have to unplug it, and the plug it in again in order to get the charging to resume.
customer_reviews.author: DrDM

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid radio for home use
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a radio to replace the one in the bathroom. If you search for "weatherproof radios" you get either weather radios or ones you can use in the shower, which I have no desire to do. I wanted a good, sturdy radio that I could keep in a steamy bathroom without damaging it. After much research I found this one. It was highly rated and deservedly so. Great sound, good controls, etc. The only thing that keeps me from giving it five stars is that the AM band is very weak in comparison to FM. I have to actually turn the radio to get a clear signal. Other than that, I highly recommend this radio.
customer_reviews.author: Old Time Hockey

customer_reviews.title: Convenient size, great sound.
customer_reviews.text: We originally purchased this radio to store as a battery-powered radio on stand-by during power failures. I was surprised by the great sound quality from its small speaker. It has a nice low-end and distortion free sound, not typical of small speakers which are so tinny and squawky sounding they can actually get on your nerves after 15 minutes. The controls are very easy and straight-forward. There is no big learning curve here. There is surprisingly little to no noise, hash or buzzing on most AM stations. It's definitely a radio we'll be keeping out of storage and for regular use. Its quality really surprised us.
customer_reviews.author: vvwwvv

customer_reviews.title: Quit working
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. Less than a year old and it no longer works.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Thorburn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent clock radio
customer_reviews.text: It's an excellent radio. Digital tuner and presets are easy to use. Sound quality is superb for the size and price. Alarm works well and the batteries can recharge without removing them. I ordered it four days before the hurricane and received it three days after it hit. Lucky we didn't lose power this time!
customer_reviews.author: Bartleby Scrivener

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this long ago
customer_reviews.text: Radio reception is already bad in my home, but trying to tune in a station on an old radio was really frustrating. This digital radio is the solution to both problems! So easy to set the station and the sound is crystal clear. I love it so much, I bought a second one (the Sangean PR-D5BK) for another room in the house. I wish the volume control had a numeric scale (like on a TV), but this is a minor issue.
customer_reviews.author: Karen H.

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I live in a wrong part of the country
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the rave reviews, I ordered one with high expection but my experience is not good. In Houston, TX, I could not pick up the local KTRH 7400 AM station without all the interference and static noise. So , the unit went back to Amazon. The ECO DOT comes to the rescue with clear reception as if I am sitting next to the talk show host. Not recommended in zipe code 77084.
customer_reviews.author: andrew c doan

customer_reviews.title: Great radio
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Have not yet tried it with batteries, but it's super using 110v. This digital radio is much better than my old analog radio, where the stations wandered around, and I was constantly adjusting the dial. And, because it is digital, it even picks up low-power far-away stations that might be blocked by adjacent stations---for example, in my area, 105.1 blocks out 105.5---but not with digital tuning! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: William McGovern

customer_reviews.title: On Off Button Fails
customer_reviews.text: I must press the on off button two or three times to get the radio to turn on. The same to get it to turn off. I called Sangean customer service and they told me that because I received it as a gift and had no receipt, it was not covered under warranty. That is very bad customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Everything else about this radio is very nice, clear sound
customer_reviews.text: I've had this a while, just wanted to say that the power button is going to bail eventually (I see it starting to act up occasionally) still working though. Everything else about this radio is very nice, clear sound, excellent low volume control, good reception, clock & related functions work well, hope the power button hangs in there, really will miss it when it goes (*...*)
customer_reviews.author: Mystic Wharf Rat

customer_reviews.title: Nice, sensible, and well finished
customer_reviews.text: The choice of push button digital radios that are easy on the eye is very limited. This fits in well with my basically white and marble kitchen. The sound is good (but I wish it had some kind of "tone" control) and it picks up all the four radio stations I need. Also you can put in 6 standard or rechargeable batteries if you want to move it around. Only 4 stars because something this electronically simple should not be this price!
customer_reviews.author: kenw

customer_reviews.title: Great radio for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a top of the line radio. The radio has the best FM reception of any of my other radios. The digital tuning and the led screen makes tuning a breeze even in the dark. You can feel the quality just by picking it up and turning the smoothest volume control ever. Using rechargeable batteries works for me, along with the radios fast recharge time. I can't say enough about how happy I am with it. Instructions come with it as well as being available online. It would have been helpful if a leather carrying case was made available or included.
customer_reviews.author: Tom G

customer_reviews.title: Great Portable Radio
customer_reviews.text: Great small radio that runs on battery or electric. The reception in my area is perfect. Save stations using digital dial. This is perfect radio for hurricane kit or power outages. I move radio from room to room and even use in my garage when working. Radio high quality. Fair price. Good value for money. Radio arrived on time. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Poor AM Reception
customer_reviews.text: The selling point on the Sangean Radio is the digital AM reception being clear on this device. It's never easy to consistently get good AM reception from any low to mid priced portable radio and this was no different. It received FM stations well but if you are looking for AM reception either save your money or go to a higher end radio.
customer_reviews.author: john g teixeira jr

customer_reviews.title: Hard-to-find, simple to operate AM-FM radio - love it!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent and hard-to-find AM-FM radio. I could only find it on Amazon. I love the simple, easy-to-use controls. One button switch from AM-FM with five pre-set buttons for each band. There's a clock/alarm feature too. All very easy to operate. And I can use rechargeable AA batteries or the regular alkaline type. Reception is outstanding. Sound is top quality .I would recommend this radio to anyone who wants an easy-to-use radio that works beautifully!
customer_reviews.author: Wordchipper

customer_reviews.title: Power adapter connection is junk — believe the reviews!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second PR-D7. I love the sound quality, size and ease of use. But believe the reviews that complain about the terrible power adapter connection. My first one didn’t have the issue for almost a year, and I disconnected and reconnected that thing several times a day until it failed. I opened it up and re-soldered the broken connection on the circuit board. That worked for a while. I finally got a second PR-D7 hoping Sangean had fixed this totally inexcusable and long standing problem. Nope. This one failed the first time I plugged it in. Returning it and not asking for a replacement. I really want this particular radio but I won’t take a chance again.
customer_reviews.author: mjbankins

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little radio
customer_reviews.text: I love this radio! I was looking for a portable radio that was battery operated for emergencies and choose this one because it can recharge rechargeable batteries(I bought amazon high capacity rechargeable battery’s as well). It has a very sleek look and sounds great for one speaker. I find myself leaving on all day. I have owned all kinds of expensive small radios and definitely recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: C. Napoli

customer_reviews.title: Nice Features
customer_reviews.text: The product is well designed and nice looking. It has a quality speaker and I really enjoy the pre-sets. I like taking it outside from time to time so it needed to be portable and sturdy in case it got dropped or knocked over. The clock comes in handy as well. I'm also impressed with the reception power. My previous radio couldn't pick up FM stations with any consistency and didn't last two years. I think this product gives you quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: aires

customer_reviews.title: Like it so much I own two
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I like it so much that 4 years after buying my first one, I bought another just so I wouldn't keep having it to bring it up and down from the first and second floor. It is great to have digital tuning... Some other inexpensive portable radios still have a tuner knob, and you have to carefully try to dial in your favorite station and keep loosing it. It produces a great clear sound, despite having only one speaker. It is so convenient to have it constantly charged because it recharges its own batteries whenever plugged in. I've even asked for a third for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Great radio for the money but just for about 9 months. Purchased in Oct 2019, now It is July3, 2020 and voila, message in window shows "E" and does not turn on. No amount of fidgeting, new batteries, etc. can get the message "E" off the screen. The radio no longer turns on. Junk, I will never buy a Sangean again.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Gangi

customer_reviews.title: Great at pulling in weak stations
customer_reviews.text: I use this primarily for talk radio. The PLL system is great at tuning in weak stations and isolating from stronger stations on close frequencies. Digital display is so much easier than the old dial. Also the ability to use rechargeable batteries (must remember to flip switch in battery compartment), and when plugged in will recharge the batteries. It was just what I was looking for and worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: paul alti

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had the radio unpacked, up and running within one minute. It was easy to find the station I wanted and save it as radio station #1. It was easy to adjust the volume. The sound quality is exceptional, especially considering the radio's small size! I recently got rid of two clock radios that were too complicated to use with ease. I also tried another product and returned it because it wasn't user friendly. Finally I got the right thing!
customer_reviews.author: CJM

customer_reviews.title: Won't charge
customer_reviews.text: It simply doesn't recharge, and that's the main reason I chose it. Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed – AM reception not too good. I set it side by side with the radio (lessor model) it was to replace. This radio had a loud hum on one station that came in strong where the old radio did not have a hum. This radio could not pull in 2 weaker stations where the old radio could. I will be returning....
customer_reviews.author: McDade TX

customer_reviews.title: Tiny and Tinny
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radio to use outdoors while I am gardening or just relaxing, and I am disappointed by its performance. Its small size and single speaker result in an unsatisfactory sound. The radio uses six AA batteries which means that a limited amount of use requires them to be changed frequently. I do like the use of preset buttons for favorite stations, both AM and FM. I do not recommend pruchase of this item.
customer_reviews.author: DHK

customer_reviews.title: Love the radio
customer_reviews.text: Love the radio.BUT this is my second one with the same problem. Where you plug the ac adaptor in on the side of the radio it quits working. Not sure why. One lasted a year last one less than 2 months. Not happy for the price of the radio. Have a friend on his 3rd with same problem
customer_reviews.author: Opp

customer_reviews.title: This one is just perfect and it comes in loud and clear
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small white radio for my bathroom. This one is just perfect and it comes in loud and clear. I read the customer reviews and they were all good. I knew I could not go wrong after reading them. This radio can be used with or without batteries. I use the batteries and the stations come in very clear. I don't have to mess with a dial trying to locate the station. I really like this radio and I would recommend it to anyone who is looking for this type of radio. You can't go wrong. It is very slim and compact and pretty much will fit anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Russo's Ranking

customer_reviews.title: Very cool little radio
customer_reviews.text: Very cool little radio. I bought it for the preset buttons. I had an old jam box with a dial tuner which was hard to flip stations. I keep it in the bathroom. I can flip between my favorite morning show on the rock station to NPR and back when there are commercials or I just want to hear the news. It's surprisingly loud and you can program it like a clock radio to come on at a certain time. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Coop

customer_reviews.title: The sound and station selection are great, but the charger didn't work to recharge rechargeable ...
customer_reviews.text: The sound and station selection are great, but the charger didn't work to recharge rechargeable batteries. We have another Sangean radio PR-D7 which we love and why we bought a second one. Even the charger from the first one didn't charge the batteries so we didn't know if it was the charger or something in the radio which didn't allow the charge. We returned the radio.
customer_reviews.author: Faye G.

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: Good little radio. Easy to set to preferences and easy to operate. I'm hard of hearing and I need a small speaker to give me clear voice on talk programs. This radio has just a little too much bass to be perfect for me, but it is very good and most people will find it excellent. Battery charge lasts several days.
customer_reviews.author: jp reid

customer_reviews.title: Read everything about the item you r going to purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed that the radio does not have a handle or in a leather case with a handle, so if you have any info where I can get some kind of leather case to put it in I would appreciate it.Thanks Jerryread
customer_reviews.author: jerry lykins

customer_reviews.title: Long Term Quality
customer_reviews.text: I do not know how many years I've had this Unit, but it sits on my Office Desk and it's my every day go to. I go to Coffee Machine and I go to my Desk Radio. I program in my AM Radio Stations and FM Stations and I can INSTANTLY switch from Morning Traffic News to my Music stations. Portability is awesome for Camping or Boating. YES I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CHARLES

product_meta.title: Sangean PR-D7 BK AM/FM Digital Rechargeable Portable Radio - Black
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Style:SingleIf you're short on space, this Sangean AM/FM Digital Rechargeable Compact Portable Radio fits in small spaces without sacrificing functionality. Conveniently located controls make it easy to use even if you're just waking up and your eyes are still blurry. The radio can be set to automatically turn off after 120, 90, 60, 45, 30, or 15 minutes, so you can fall asleep to the sound of music, talk, or news.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


The PR-D7 BK is a true ultra-compact portable AM/FM digital radio that's a mere 8" long and stands 4-1/2" tall, and weighs 1.3 lbs. All controls are conveniently located and you can see the frequency and time on the display. The tone is well balanced and excellent for both talk and music.

Ultra-compact portable radio that's excellent for both talk and music. View larger The PR-D7 BK has excellent sensitivity and selectivity and will surprise you at its ability to pull in those distant stations. Five presets are available on each band and the auto seek will automatically seek the active stations across the entire band rather than to the next frequency. The radio can be set to automatically turn off after 120, 90, 60, 45, 30, or 15 minutes, so you can fall asleep to the sound of music, talk, or news. A sleep alarm allows you to wake up to music or a beeper with HWS (Humane Wake System). You can power it with the included AC adapter, or six regular or rechargeable "AA" size batteries (not included).

LCD DISPLAY
An easy-to-read LCD display shows you station and time. The segment-style LCD screen measures 3.2" x 0.9", and is backlit to be easy to see even across the room.

A backlit LCD display is easy-to-read and shows your station and time CONVENIENT RADIO FUNCTIONS
PLL synthesized tuning provides exact, fade-free reception. Ten Memory Presets for 5 AM or 5 FM station selection are available and easily visible in the large LCD display. Fill your presets with Auto Seek, which finds your active stations automatically.

HUMANE WAKE SYSTEM
The PR-D5 features a sleep timer with a radio alarm to turn on your favorite station at a predetermined time. There's also a Humane Wake System (HWS) buzzer alarm, which wakes you up gradually with an incrementally increasing alarm instead of a harsh, instant noise. You can set the radio to turn itself off automatically after 15, 30, 45, 60, 90, or 120 minutes.

RECHARGEABLE BATTERIES
In addition the PR-D7 BK can be powered with six rechargeable AA batteries which you can charge right in the radio. When the radio is plugged in via AC power, it will charge your rechargeable AA batteries, so you'll always be ready to take the PR-D7 BK on the road with you.

TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS
 * Display: LCD
 * Display Size: 3.2" x 0.9"
 * Memory Presets: 10 (5 AM, 5 FM)
 * Tuner Type: PLL synthesized AM/FM
 * Dial Type: Button up/down
 * Alarm: Radio and HWS (Humane Wake System)
 * Speakers: 1 x 3" full-range
 * Input Power: AC, Batteries (AA)
 * Dimensions: 8.5" x 4.6" x 1.6"
 * Weight: 1lb 4.3oz
feature_bullets: Alarm by radio or Humane Wake System buzzer

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,955 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
